Articles.Content:
This thing is everywhere. Everyone copies it, sometimes remaking it to look nicer; even I do.

  • What is it
  • What's the cross in the middle
  • What's the thick line
  • What are the ovals
  • What is the triangle

1) It's gray.

2) It's where the giant Phillips screwdriver goes.

3) It's the coin slot

4) They're elongated circles

5) It's a warning sticker sans any warning.

Hope that helped.
It seems to be a hatch. I would guess the cross is supposed to look raised, i.e. so it can be twisted (the wheel/handle/whatever on a hatch), no idea about the slot.
I'm guessing the triangle means "this way is up."

It seems to be a hatch. I would guess the cross is supposed to look raised, i.e. so it can be twisted (the wheel/handle/whatever on a hatch), no idea about the slot.

I've always seen it as this too: A hatch with submarine-style doorwheel (cross) for detaching it and a handle (line) for lifting it out of the way inside the craft. No idea what the ovals are, likely greeble. The yellow triangle appears to be a warning sign which is too small for text.

It's existed since before the game had detailed textures, and seems to have become a skeuomorph for "attachment point that crew could possibly transfer though but is definitely not a docking port, please attach one".

Soyuz:

ISS:

Edited January 13, 2015 by pizzaoverhead

1) It's gray.

2) It's where the giant Phillips screwdriver goes.

3) It's the coin slot

4) They're elongated circles

5) It's a warning sticker sans any warning.

Hope that helped.

Bless you

I've always seen it as this too: A hatch with submarine-style doorwheel (cross) for detaching it

As lame as that texture is, don't you think they would still try to connect the cross to the circle if it really was a doorwheel?
Yeah, I've always seen the cross as more of an alignment guide, with the slot being a small window.

It's a nice generic circle texture.

Textures have lots of generic circles that need filling.

The big horizontal line is actually where a handhold goes, if you look inside the Hitchhiker Storage Container.

I never really thought about it. I mean, I knew it was a hatch, probably a crew transfer path, but I never really thought about what it was based on. I've grown too attached to it. I don't want it to go.

As lame as that texture is, don't you think they would still try to connect the cross to the circle if it really was a doorwheel?

The curved-corner segment shape they'd need for that isn't one of the basic autoshapes drawing programs have which the image appears to be composed of.

Alternatively, a larger one of these:
The cross and ovals along with a yellow triangle are the ancient mystic symbols that are deeply connected with Kerbal culture so they add these anywhere just for luck.

As lame as that texture is, don't you think they would still try to connect the cross to the circle if it really was a doorwheel?

The curved-corner segment shape they'd need for that isn't one of the basic autoshapes drawing programs have which the image appears to be composed of.

Alternatively, a larger one of these:

- - - Updated - - -

The big horizontal line is actually where a handhold goes, if you look inside the Hitchhiker Storage Container.

That's one element confirmed:

The same seems to be true for similar symbols on the outside:

Whatever the actual mechanism is, the circle and plus appear to be the means of unlatching the door. The warning triangle orientation also serves as a reference for any hinge direction the door might have.

Edited January 14, 2015 by pizzaoverhead

On 13.1.2015 at 5:24 AM, Voidryder said:

3) It's the coin slot

  funny -  ok i study at moment some "Airlock- hatch" option for another project -  but this comment i like it very much... I would very much like to have - I believe I make such an "insert coin" slot at my house door

 

 i think the this airlock-hatch form the japanese KIBO ISS module is not bad for a KSP mod. - it looks very nice.

( frankly - i never like the stock hatches - its a to procedural pragmatic design style)
